answers.answer: My concern is the glucose in your urine.  Its hard to fathom a doctor who does not administer a traditional 1 hr. GTT during pregnancy.  I'm stunned to hear in this day and age there are doctors who won't test for it.  There are very serious reasons to test for gestational diabetes, which you could easily have.  There is no way to know for sure, since your doctor won't test you.  I just can't wrap my head around WHY he won't.  His reason is nonsense.There are several reasons to measure big, and one might be that you are having a larger baby (which, if you have gestational diabetes you would be more at risk for), or that you have gained more weight than is indicated.  Which is true so far.Estimates of the fetal weight done late in pregnancy are less accurate than those done earlier.  I don't know if they'll measure your cervical length or not.  It probably isn't as important as getting a test for gestational diabetes would be, unless you have a history of preterm labor or delivery.Good luck.

Don't worry about those measurements, they are not terribly accurate.I think your sugar is borderline, so I would cut out all sugar for the next little while.That roast beef dinner sure sounds good.....

I am guessign if you have sugar in your urine--that you may have gd--just because you passed the test with out the glucose drink--I measured large also and it was because I was diabetic--and I only gained 17lbs with my pgs--because of the diet I was on--try and cut out carbs as much as you can--that will lower your sugars and help with the weight gain.

You said:"I was tested 3 weeks ago and don't have GD. I never drank a sugar drink, doctor believes in eating normal and checking that way."How can you test for GD and not drink the glucose load?  Did I miss something?

You didn't miss anything,He just says eating a normal meal that you would have and having blood drawn 1 hr later is more accurate. He thinks drinking tons of sugar is unrealistic and that we wouldn't normally do that.  I don't know, in one way it makes sense.  But I would like to get to the bottom of it.  It worries me. I don't want my baby to have problem during delivery or right after.I'm hoping the u/s shows somethingThanks for your input..   :)

"He thinks drinking tons of sugar is unrealistic and that we wouldn't normally do that."The glucose drinks are not THAT sugared.  They're really no different than drinking a pop.  If your doctor thinks it's unrealisitic for a person to drink a pop then he's off his rocker.You can't test for GD without having the glucose drink.  IMO, your GD test is bogus.  Your doc has no idea whether or not you have GD.  I am glad that you're looking into this because having GD could very well be why you're measuring big and having a big baby.Good luck and keep working to find answers.

Marcus's mommy,Yes, it sounds attractive to explain it that way.  But the very definition of GD depends on how a pregnant womans body reacts to a known glucose load that is measured and administered in a controlled manner.   Normally, a pregnant womans body handles this load by responding with predictable values of her blood glucose that fall within established ranges.A pregnant woman with GD has an abnormal response to this certain, particular amount of the known carbohydrate load.  Clearly, your body is not handling carbohydrates in a normal manner.  A pregnant woman can sometimes spill some small amounts of glucose in the urine, but without the regulation test, you cannot know if it is normal or not.I agree with JJety this could very well be the reason why you are measuring big.  But without the test, you will be missing a piece of the puzzle.  There are risks associated with having Gd above and beyond just having a big baby, too.

Here's a link to what the American College of Obstetrics and Gynecology recommends, so far as routine testing in pregnancy.  Look under BLOOD TESTS, last paragraph in that section.These are the tests recommended by ACOG.  Your doctor is not following ACOG guidelines.http://www.acog.org/publications/patient_education/bp133.cfm

*waggles hairy toes in a mysterious manner*Nurse?  I do watch a lot of medical shows while I'm installing my cable systems...hmm....I suppose you might consider me one...
I misread that and thought you were waggling your hairy nose.

Hairy toes????  I thought only hobbits had hairy feet....Installing cable huh?  My dh and the brats would love cable, I keep saying no.  Pretty sad considering I work in the film industry.  Don't want the products of my hard work rotting their minds.Waxing will help with the feet.

I have GD and took the one hour test and failed had to do the three hour test, still failed.  In the three hour test they take you blood before you start.  Mine was normal, and over the three hours it went up.  I have to take a 500mg pill twice a day.  I also have the diet, but just do my best to stay away from most sugar (you can have splendia).  But I lost three lbs in two weeks.  Baby is measuring on track, so far and I am 34 weeks.  Dr. said something about changing my dosage on the pills if it can't keep up as I get more pregnant, so sounds to me like the farther along you go, you sugar levels can need higher dosages of medication for control.  Good luck hope you get things figured out, if your dr. won't do the test with the drink then maybe go to another ob for a second opinion.
Hm.  Perhaps I am a hobbit, along with being a discontent and a ne'er do well.Nurse Hobbit.  Might be a good screen name, eh?*waggles hairy toes again and disappears in a puff of baby dust*

Which is an excellent hospital, but that is not were he works.I don't know, I'm so confused about it all. Maybe I'm borderline...

My intuition says you should have the test.  Sometimes really popular docs are very busy and not as careful as they should be.I am actually staying with my gp, but being seen at the high risk clinic at the grace as well.  She will deliver if all goes well.  I like the idea of the same doc caring for my family throughout our lives.Anyhow, I would request the test.  I know EVERY pregnant woman gets it here.I am supposed to go to Sarnia for a wedding in June, will be 7 months, I think I will stay home!!  I hear your summers are very hot.

question: Hello ladies,Today I am 31 weeks pregnant. I had my doctors appointment last night. I now weight 200 pounds. I have gained 30 pounds. That part doesn't bother me too much. But I have some questions...#1  For the last 3 visits I have had traces of sugar in my urine. Last night she said I had +2. The urine strip has normal, +1, +2, +3, +4. I'm not sure if the last 2 times were +1 or +2.  I was tested 3 weeks ago and don't have GD. I never drank a sugar drink, doctor believes in eating normal and checking that way.  The nurse said we need to keep an eye on it and I shouldn't eat ice cream.  I had a bowl of it after a healthy meal of roast beef, carrots and potatoes. That was my only sweet of the day.  Is this something to worry about? Anyone else have sugar in urine but don't have GD?#2  Three weeks ago I measured 2 weeks big, last night I now measure 3 weeks big. My LMP is accurate, even my first u/s at 7 weeks confirmed it. Now what causes us to measure big? Am I having a huge baby?  Marcus was only 6 lbs 11 oz and 2 days early and I gained 55 lbs. I don't thing my body can pass a 9 lbs or 10 lbs baby.  Or does this mean I could go early?They will be calling me this week with another u/s appointment, so I will be asking 1. weight of baby, 2. cervical thickness, and is there anything else?Thank you ladies.
